alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 8:21AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northern Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 821 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, or 16 miles south of Valentine, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Ainsworth, Springview, Johnstown, Norden, Wood Lake, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, North River Trail, Sparks, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Antelope Peak, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River and Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 203 and 224. Highway 20 between mile markers 193 and 244. Highway 97 between mile markers 134 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 189 and 221. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
